text: NF-kappaB regulates <extra_id_0> Fas <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> APO-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> CD95 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - and TCR - mediated apoptosis of T lymphocytes .
The maintenance of lymphocyte homeostasis by apoptosis is a critical regulatory mechanism in the normal immune system .

The transcription factor NF-kappaB has been shown to play a role in protecting cells against death mediated by TNF We show here that NF-kappaB also has a role in regulating <extra_id_0> Fas <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> APO-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> CD95 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - mediated death , a major pathway of peripheral T cell death .

Transfection of Jurkat cells with the NF-kappaB subunits <extra_id_0> p50 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> confers resistance against <extra_id_0> Fas <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - mediated apoptosis .

text: Reciprocally , inhibition of NF-kappaB activation by a soluble peptide inhibitor or a dominant form of the NF-kappaB inhibitor , IkappaB , makes the cells more susceptible to <extra_id_0> Fas <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - mediated apoptosis .
Furthermore , inhibition of NF-kappaB activation by a soluble peptide inhibitor rendered a T cell hybridoma more susceptible to TCR - mediated apoptosis .

Correspondingly , transfection of <extra_id_0> p50 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> provided considerable protection from TCR - mediated apoptosis .

text: These observations were corroborated by studies on <extra_id_0> Fas <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - mediated death in primary T cells .

Concanavalin A - activated cycling T cell blasts from mice that are transgenic for the dominant IkappaB molecule have increased sensitivity to <extra_id_0> Fas <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - mediated apoptosis , associated with a down-regulation of NF-kappaB complexes in the nucleus .

In addition , blocking TNF , itself a positive regulator of NF-kappaB , with neutralizing antibodies renders the cells more susceptible to anti - <extra_id_0> Fas <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - mediated apoptosis .

In summary , our results provide compelling evidence that NF-kappaB protects against <extra_id_0> Fas <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - mediated death and is likely to be an important regulator of T cell homeostasis and tolerance .
